content.name: Jupiler
content.description: The Jupiler is one of the most popular beer in Belgium, and is the typical pils you would find in the bar next door. It is made in Jupille (near Liège), hence its name.

content.name: Cuvee des Trolls
content.description: The Cuvee des Trolls is an strong blond artisan's beer with slight hints of orange and honey. A reference in Belgian beers!

content.name: Duvel
content.description: The Duvel is a refreshing bitter blond beer with a hoppy taste and a high alcool degree.

content.name: Leffe blonde
content.description: Leffe is a well-known bittersweet blond abbey beer

content.name: Grimbergen blonde
content.description: The Grimbergen is an blond beer, with tan reflections and recognized as a belgian abbey beer. It has a sweet and light fruity aroma.

content.name: Westmalle Triple
content.description: Westmalle Tripel is a golden yellow abbey beer, fermented 3 times. It has a powerful creamy aroma with a light hop and fruity scent with a unique aftertaste. The beer is still made by Westmalle Abbey's monks, which incomes is dedicated to monastic livelihood; which makes this beer one of the only 6 trappist beers in Belgium !

content.name: Ginette Triple Bio
content.description: This big sister completes the Ginette family. With a sufficient amount of bitterness, a flavour of elderflower and a strong character (9°)!

content.name: Maredsous Triple
content.description: Maredsous is an abbey beer, with an oranged blond robe. It has a strong malted taste, with spicy notes.

content.name: Barbar
content.description: The Barbar is a deep blond with a creamy texture and powerful aroma made by the Brasserie Lefebvre. For more sweetness, there is a subtle scent of honey that makes this beer unique

content.name: Moinette Bio
content.description: The moinette is an refreshing organic blond beer with a balance of soft, bitter and fruity favours.

content.name: Chimay Bleue
content.description: Chimay Bleue is a dark trappist beer, with a very sweet taste, close to caramel or chocolate. Once bottled, it maturates very well over years.

content.name: Leffe Brune
content.description: Leffe is a well-known sweet brown beer made with torrefied malt.

content.name: Goose IPA
content.description: Our India Pale Ale recalls a time when ales shipped from England to India were highly hopped to preserve their distinct taste during the long journey. The result is a hop lover’s dream with a fruity aroma, set off by a dry malt middle, and long hop finish.

content.name: Goose Honkers Ale
content.description: Inspired by visits to English country pubs, Honker’s Ale combines a spicy hop aroma with a rich malt middle to create a perfectly balanced beer. Immensely drinkable, Honker’s Ale is not only a beer drinkers can trust but one they’ll look forward to.

content.name: Pecheresse
content.description: The pecheresse is a fruity lambic with a very strong sweet peach taste.

content.name: Kriek Lindemans
content.description: The kriek is a typical fruity beer, made from lambic and cherries. The Lindemans is also pasteurised, and results in a very light, sweet and refreshing beer.

content.name: Ginette Fruit Bio
content.description: A fruity lady made out of raspberry, blackcurrant, blueberry and even elderberry juice. At 4% alc/vol, she is light, slighly sweet and would almost make you forget that she is indeed a beer.

content.name: Hoegaarden Blanche
content.description: The Hoegaarden is the most famous white beer in and outside of Belgium. It is a sweet and refreshing beer, brewed with coriander and lemon which makes it even more refreshing.
